item.title: Emberville – Convergence Games Showcase ’26 trailer
item.content:encoded:
• PC

Abubakar Salim joins the cast.

Cygnus Cross has released a new trailer for action adventure RPG Emberville showcasing new gameplay footage and announcing the latest addition to the game’s cast.

Abubakar Salim, who previously voiced Bayek of Siwa in Assassin’s Creed Origins and portrayed Alyn of Hull in House of the Dragon, is the latest addition to the game’s voice cast.

“I look for projects that take risks, and Emberville is absolutely pushing the envelope,” said Salim in a press release. “Seeing how this team is deconstructing the genre is inspiring, and doing it with such intellect and intent is awesome.”

Previously confirmed as a core cast member, Alex Jordan will also serve as the game’s performance director.

“The thing that really makes any project stand out to me is the developers themselves, the people at the core of it all,” said Jordan. “You can have the best concept in the world, but if the team isn’t utterly devoted and approaching it with a level of detail and nuance, the result will always be mediocre. Cygnus Cross showed me that not only is Emberville an incredibly cool idea, but they also have that detail and nuance in overflowing abundance. Their care and commitment to creating something with legacy and quality for their players is what truly makes me excited about Emberville. Oh, and I lied to Doug [Cockle] about him getting sausages to help get the deal across the line… don’t tell him.”

Previously revealed cast member Doug Cockle added, “The passion, skill, and experience going into the development of this game is phenomenal. I’m always attracted to projects where the team has a clear goal in mind, and the drive and knowledge to reach for it, especially when that goal pushes boundaries. That’s exciting to be part of. Plus, they told me there would be small sausages. I like small sausages.”

Emberville is due out in Early Access for PC via Steam this summer.

Watch the trailer below.

item.title: Tag-team fighting-infused RPG A Fighter’s Nova: Mindara announced for PC
item.content:encoded:
• PC

Kickstarter campaign coming soon.

Montreal-based developer BadRez Games has announced A Fighter’s Nova: Mindara, a narrative-driven, Japanese-inspired RPG that fuses “rich storytelling and exploration with the disciple and intensity of a true fighting game.” It will be available for PC via Steam. A Kickstarter campaign is coming soon.

Here is an overview of the game, via BadRez Games:

About

A Fighter’s Nova: Mindara is a narrative-driven JRPG that fuses character-focused storytelling with the intensity and precision of a true tag-team fighting game.

You follow Maya, a determined teenage martial artist searching for her own purpose, and Mindara, a mysterious wolf-man haunted by an unjust banishment and driven by revenge. Their journey leads them to a legendary tournament held within a hidden magical city—an arena where destiny, myth, and ambition collide.

As they travel, you’ll meet a diverse cast of companions—each with their own motivations, backstories, combat styles and abilities. Through friendships, rivalries, and hard-earned trust, you’ll experience a classic JRPG-style adventure where growth, wisdom, and meaning are forged not just through dialogue, but through the art of battle itself.

Engage in Explosive Tag-Team Combat

Every encounter is a fully playable fighting game match, within a JRPG narrative experience. Battles unfold in real time with precise controls, advanced mechanics, and deep combo systems.

Switch between characters mid-fight, chain abilities together, and discover devastating tag-team synergies. Each character brings their own fighting style, signature techniques, and ultimate abilities, allowing you to experiment with team compositions and strategies.

Your relationships matter: story choices and bonds between characters directly influence combat synergy, unlocking unique duo techniques and special moves. The stronger the bond, the more spectacular—and personal their combined attacks become, seamlessly blending narrative and combat into a single riveting experience.

  • ❮
  • ❯

A Love Letter to Shonen Manga

Inspired by classic 90s manga such as Ranma 1/2, Dragon Ball, Yu Yu Hakusho, Hunter x Hunter, and more, A Fighter’s Nova: Mindara is a vibrant homage to Japanese storytelling. Its manga-style black-and-white panels, illustrated by multiple-award-winning manga artist Issaka Galadima (Clock Striker), give each cutscene a bold yet familiar look.

All of this will be set to the soaring melodies of a magical new soundtrack by Hiroki Kikuta, the original composer for Secret of Mana.

Key Features

  • Embark on a true JRPG narrative adventure with explosive fighting mechanics and seamless transitions between story and combat.
  • Switch heroes at any time with dynamic tag gameplay, choosing which companion to lead the game.
  • Discover unique skills for each hero to bring their own flair to the fight.
  • Build bonds between characters to enhance combos and unlock new tactical options.
  • Feast your eyes on graphic manga cutscenes that enhance dialog and set your deepest emotions aflame.
  • Play to win or to be challenged with simplified controls for newcomers and advanced precision for seasoned players.
  • Local couch cooperative with a friend.

Watch the announcement trailer below. View the first screenshots at the gallery.

item.title: GRIME II launches March 31
item.content:encoded:
• PC

Metroidvania game sequel dated.

Metroidvania game sequel GRIME II will launch for PC via Steam on March 31, publisher Kwalee and developer Clover Bite announced.

Here is an overview of the game, via Clover Bite:

About

Become the stealer of forms in GRIME II, a surreal action adventure Metroidvania. Launch tendrils made of hands to absorb foes and summon molds in their shape, as you explore a bizarre lived-in-world obsessed with art.

Story

Become a stealer of forms in GRIME II, the sequel to 2021’s acclaimed action adventure Metroidvania. You are a Formless—an art mimic, absorbing creatures and summoning molds in their shape.

Venture into a new and mysterious land in the GRIME universe, where danger and wonder await around every corner. Use your surroundings in tandem with your summoned molds to overcome deadly enemies and epic bosses, all the while exploring a deep world full of diverse cultures and characters.

Create your own playstyle by choosing from a variety of abilities, weapons, and mold summons. Learn the makings of your enemies as you summon their form to both aid you in combat, as well as in exploring the various secrets paths of the world.

Key Features

  • Molds – Absorb defeated enemies, shaping them into molds which can then be used for special attacks. Use molds to throw enemies, fire projectiles, stun, and even turn into summons.
  • Environmental Combat – Wherever you go, the environment provides ample opportunities to damage enemies nearby or from a distance. Be wary, for they can do the same to you!
  • Parry and Grasp – Send hand-tendrils to either parry enemy attacks or grasp and absorb them, drawing you closer to learning their shape.
  • A Lived-In World – Discover incredible locations made of painted nails and giant vases, each with its own unique civilization, culture, and deep characters to converse with.

Watch a new trailer below.

item.title: Fallen Tear: The Ascension launches in Early Access for PC on March 17
item.content:encoded:
• PC

Console versions to follow alongside full release.

Side-scrolling Metroidvania game Fallen Tear: The Ascension will launch in Early Access for PC via Steam on March 17 for $19.99, followed by a full release across PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, Switch 2, Switch, Xbox One, and PC at a later date, publisher CMD Studios and developer Winter Crew announced.

“The world of Fallen Tear: The Ascension has evolved so much over the years,” said CMD Studios founder Stephen Manalastas in a press release. “The Early Access release is packed with areas to explore, bosses to face, and Fated Bonds to enhance Hira’s adventuring prowess. We’re excited to hear the passionate voices of our incredible community throughout Early Access, and can’t wait to shape Fallen Tear into an experience like no other.”

Here are the latest details, via CMD Studios:

To forge a high-quality, distinct Metroidvania experience for its loyal community of fans and Kickstarter backers, CMD Studios and Winter Crew plan to work with their community to provide early access updates over the coming months. With 15-20 hours of content, the Early Access release includes 10 interconnected regions, six main bosses (and three optional bosses!), and the story’s opening act.

Rove through the lush forests and expansive caves of Raoah as Hira, a mysterious child burdened with the task of facing ancient gods. Befriend allies to establish Fated Bonds, and harness their powers to utilize their abilities in both combat and traversal. Upgrade skills and masteries throughout Hira’s journey to take on ferocious monsters.

Presented through meticulously hand-drawn 2D animation and full voice acting, explore Raoah’s ever-changing map, transforming in response to Hira’s actions, and uncover every secret buried within. Beloved JRPG elements weave seamlessly into the Metroidvania formula: discover new party members strewn across Raoah, and call upon their combined power with a Fated Rush attack. Seek out hidden pathways, learn enemy attack patterns, and master deep mechanics.

Watch a new trailer below.

item.title: Voidling Bound launches June 9 for PC, later for PS5, Xbox Series, and Switch 2
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS5
  • Switch 2
  • Xbox Series

A monster-taming action RPG built on evolution and DNA splicing.

Monster-taming action RPG Voidling Bound will launch for PC via Steam on June 9, followed by PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, and Switch 2 at a later date, developer Hatchery Games announced.

An updated demo is currently available for PC as part of Steam Next Fest: February 2026 Edition. Save data from the demo will carry over to the full game when it launches. The updated demo features new animated narrative introduction, full support for nine languages, access to Gilick’s Cryo Branch, a new enemy faction, modified maps available beyond the main quest, significant performance optimizations, and improved sounds, visual effects, and animations.

Here is an overview of the game, via its Steam page:

About

Become a Space Wrangler and take direct control of creatures called “Voidlings” in this action-packed science-fiction third-person shooter. Shape them through branching evolution paths and upgrade their abilities to overcome bubonic swarms, pestilent bosses, and reclaim lush planets overrun by corruption.

Key Features

  • Bound as One – Defenseless against a devastating parasite threatening all life forms, humanity must team up with recently discovered Voidlings to unlock their full potential through the neural bond. Become bound as one, as the last line of defense in our fight for survival.
  • Take Control – Shoot, slash, slam, and blast your way through battles. Evade, block, or parry incoming attacks. Sprint, jump, and dash across diverse biomes and planets. Charge and unleash devastating ultimate abilities to defeat the most challenging foes.
  • Choose Your Evolution Path – Evolve across branching paths to customize your elemental alignment, appearance, playstyle, and abilities. Discover powerful mutated perks that change how each Voidling is played. Craft and pick the right Voidling for each challenge.
  • Upgrade and Customize – Level up your Voidlings and assign attribute points to customize their playstyle: strength, vitality, essence, recuperation, or agility—the choice is yours. Research deep and powerful ability upgrades to improve their capacities.
  • Cleanse the World – Cleanse vibrant handcrafted planets oozing with diverse enemies, each posing unique gameplay challenges. Complete missions and survive challenging arenas to find precious resources, research points, eggs and mutagens that are key in your fight against the parasite.
  • Fill Your Vivarium – Discover new Voidlings by rescuing and hatching eggs from infested locations. Get lucky and hatch rare natures that empower your Voidlings. Breed to combine natures and attributes for even more power.
  • Complete Your Collection – Acquire all Voidlings, collect body parts, colors, and eye genes to customize your specimens. Acquire game-changing ability genes and mutated perks to fill your collection.
  • Craft Your Perfect Specimen – Use your gene collection to craft unique Voidlings that combine the strength of all your discoveries. Unlock powerful synergies otherwise impossible to overcome ever-increasing Challenges!

Watch a new trailer below.

Release Date Trailer

item.title: GRIDbeat! launches March 26 for Switch, PC
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • Switch

High-energy, rhythm-based dungeon crawling.

Rhythm dungeon crawler GRIDbeat! will launch for Switch and PC via Steam on March 26, publisher Acclaim and developer Ridiculous Games announced.

“GRIDbeat! is built around rhythm as a core mechanic,” said Every movement, every pulse, every enemy encounter is powered by an electric soundtrack,” said Ridiculous Games senior producer Jaime Bencia in a press release. “We’re incredibly proud of what the Ridiculous Games team has accomplished and thrilled to finally share it with players. Our sincere thanks to Acclaim for their partnership and support in bringing this vision to life.”

Here is an overview of the game, via Acclaim:

About

Welcome to GRIDbeat!

A rhythm-fueled cyber-dungeon crawler where every move must match the music or risk total system shutdown.

You just breached Knoss.OS, the planet’s most fortified corporate network, and made off with a payload of priceless data. Now you’re trapped inside, hunted by rogue security protocols and hostile malware. Your only way out? Sync with the system. Move to the beat. And escape before the grid locks you down for good.

Key Features

  • Beat-Based Dungeon Crawling – In GRIDbeat!, movement, combat, and interaction all happen on the beat. Every level is a tactical challenge where rhythm equals survival.
  • Pulse-Pounding Maze Exploration – As you navigate the data labyrinths, keep an eye out for all manner of hazards, including Server Formats that can wipe a level clean.
  • Evolving Abilities and Power-Ups – Install powerful software tools to help you overcome system threats, uncover secrets and solve challenges.
  • Cyber.Mind Boss Battles – Defeat powerful AI gatekeepers in intense beat-based battles to continue your journey and reach the final exit port out of the Mainframe.
  • Step into the Rhythm! – GRIDbeat!‘s electrifying soundtrack pulls you into the action, where every move, ability, and attack pulses to the beat. Sync your gameplay with the music and let the soundtrack guide your every step through the grid!

Watch a new trailer below.

item.title: Sony Interactive Entertainment to shut down Bluepoint Games
item.content:encoded:
• PlayStation

Studio shuttered less than five years after acquisition.

Sony Interactive Entertainment will shut down Demon’s Souls and Shadow of the Colossus remakes developer Bluepoint Games in March, the company confirmed to Bloomberg.

Bluepoint Games was acquired by Sony Interactive Entertainment in September 2021, nearly one year after the release of the Demon’s Souls remake. Since then, it served as a co-developer on God of War Ragnarok. While it has not released a new game of its own, an unannounced live service game from Bluepoint Games was canceled in January 2025, which was reportedly a God of War game that began development in 2022.

Here is the full email to employees from Sony Interactive Entertainment Studio Business Group CEO Hermen Hulst on the studio’s closure, via ResetEra:

Hello everyone,

I wanted to share an important update from the Studio Business.

As I mentioned in the December Town Hall, 2025 had some strong highlights within PlayStation Studios. Ghost of Yotei launched to critical and commercial success, Death Stranding 2: On the Beach further showcased our commitment to narrative excellence, and Helldivers II and MLB The Show continue to drive on-going player engagement and revenue.

At the same time, we’re operating in an increasingly challenging industry environment. Rising development costs, slowed industry growth, changing player behavior, and broader economic headwinds are making it harder to build games sustainably.

To navigate this reality, we need to continue adapting and evolving. We’ve taken a close look at our business to ensure we’re delivering today while still well-positioned for the future. As a result, we will be closing Bluepoint Games in March.

This decision was not made lightly. Bluepoint is an incredibly talented team and their technical expertise has delivered exceptional experiences for the PlayStation community. I want to thank everyone at Bluepoint for their creativity, craftsmanship, and commitment to quality. Where possible, we will work to find opportunities for some impacted employees within our global network of studios.

While I know this is hard news to hear, I’m confident in the direction we’re headed. Creativity, innovation, and building unforgettable experiences for players remain at the heart of PlayStation Studios. We have a robust roadmap for fiscal year 26, with much to look forward to in the months ahead.

Thank you for your hard work and continued support.

Best,
Hermen Hulst
CEO, Studio Business Group
